meanings.definition: An excessive or disproportionate amount or size.
meanings.sent1: The overproportion of candy in the jar made it impossible to resist.
meanings.sent2: The overproportion of toppings on the pizza made it difficult to eat.
meanings.sent3: The overproportion of balloons at the party made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The overproportion of books on the shelf made it look like a library.
meanings.sent5: The overproportion of laughter in the room filled it with joy.

meanings.definition: To make something appear larger or more important than it actually is.
meanings.sent1: She tends to overproportion her achievements when talking to others.
meanings.sent2: The advertisement overproportions the benefits of the product.
meanings.sent3: He always overproportions his fishing stories to impress his friends.
meanings.sent4: The politician overproportions his support to gain more votes.
meanings.sent5: The artist overproportions the size of the flowers in the painting for emphasis.
